description: Thames Valley Police officers were called to Rochford Gardens in Slough on 14 February.
title: Murder investigation launched in Slough after woman dies
title_page: Murder investigation launched in Slough after woman dies - BBC News
maintext:
A murder investigation has been launched after a woman who was found in a serious condition died in hospital.
Thames Valley Police said it was called to Rochford Gardens in Slough, Berkshire, just before 15:00 GMT on 14 February and found a woman in a life-threatening condition.
Brigitta Rasuli, 53, was taken to hospital but she died on Saturday 1 March.
A 57-year-old man, Samir Rasuli, was previously charged with attempted murder and was remanded in custody to appear at Reading Crown Court on 17 March.
